description.narrative: Output 1: Ethics, meritocracy, inclusivity and responsiveness applied in Myanmar Civil Service

activity-description.narrative: Ethics, meritocracy, exclusivity and responsiveness applied in Myanmar Civil Service

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Indicator 1.1: # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel
Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy
Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8)
Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4)
Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1)
Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1)
Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented
Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures
Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity
Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit

comment.narrative:
Indicator 1.1: # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel Baseline (2017): 0
Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy Baseline (2017): a) 0; b) 0;
Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8) Baseline (2016): Gender discrimination 17%W 19%M; Racial Discrimination 15%W 16%M; Ethnic Discriminatiion TBDW% TBD%M
Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4) Baseline (2016): Recruitment based on connections 22%W 22%M Promotions based on social connections 31%W 31%M Postings based on connections 27%W 28%M Promotions and postings based on bribes 24%W 27%M
Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1) Baseline (2017): N/A
Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1) Baseline (2017): (a) 39%*; (b) n/a
Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented Baseline (2018): 0
Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures Baseline (2018): 0%W 0%M
Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity Baseline (2018): 0%W 0%M
Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit Baseline (2018): 0/0

*Targets on indicators from M&E framework 2019*
Indicator 1.1: # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel Target (2019): 4
Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy Target (2019): (a) 0 (b) 0
Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8) Targets (2019): Gender discrimination 15%W 17%M; Racial Discrimination 15%W 16%M; Ethnic Discriminatiion TBDW% TBD%M
Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men (and # of with disabilities) civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4) Targets (2019): Recruitment based on connections 22%W 22%M Promotions based on social connections 31%W 31%M Postings based on connections 27%W 28%M Promotions and postings based on bribes 24%W 27%M n/a PWD
Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1) Targets (2019): TBD%W TBD%M
Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1) Targets (2019): (a) 46%; (b) 1.2%
Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented Target (2019): 0
Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures Target (2019): 0%W 0%M
Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity Target (2019): 10%W 10%M
Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit Target (2019): 0/0

*Results on indicators from M&E framework 2019*
Result on Indicator 1.1: # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel: On track (complete data under collection)
Result on Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy: (a) 0 (b) 0 as anticipated LEAP Gender&Diversity strategy formulated
Result on Indicator 1.3: % of wo/men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8): Monitoring on hold because approval for CSPS survey pending G&D training provided by LEAP G&D Advisor at CICS UM and CICS LM
Result on Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men (and # of with disabilities) civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4): Monitoring on hold because approval for CSPS survey pending
Result on Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1): On track (complete data under collection) First-ever Public Perception of Government Services survey completed in May 2019 providing baseline for this indicator. Report under approval.
Result on Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1): For 2018 (GEPA study): 44.42% (D: 49.28%; DyDG: 32.19%; DG: 16.29%); For 2019 complete data under collection
Result on Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented: 0 as anticipated
Result on Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures: 0 as anticipated
Result on Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity: 13%W and 26%M of CICS senior trainees trained on integrity
Result on Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit: 0/0 as anticipated

Indicator 1.1:# of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel Target : 12
Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy Target: (a) 12 (b) 10
Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8) Targets: Gender discrimination 15%W 16%M; Racial Discrimination 14%W 14%M; Ethnic Discriminatiion TBDW% TBD%M
Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men (and # of with disabilities) civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4) Targets: Recruitment based on connections 21%W 21%M Promotions based on social connections 29%W 29%M Postings based on connections 25%W 25%M Promotions and postings based on bribes 22%W 24%M PWD TBD
Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1) Targets: N/A%W N/A%M
Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1) Targets : (a) 48%; (b) 2%
Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented Target : 1
Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures Target: 10%W 10%M
Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity Target : 80%W 80%M PWD 1/2
Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit Target : 1/1

Results on Indicators from M&E Framework (Jan-Dec 2020)
Result on Indicator 1.1 : # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel: Status Delayed: Evidence not found of data systematically collected by UCSB and/or the 8 pre identified government agencies. Data provided by UCSB are lacking information and only the total number of staff with number of male and female given for both UCSB and 2CICS.
Result on Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy: Status On track: The UCSB 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Action Plan has been drafted and shared with ministries for feedback. 14 ministries have given a very positive feedback.
Result on Indicator 1.3: % of wo/men civil servants witnessing gender/ race/ ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8): Status- Delayed: (CSPS) Survey data was planned to be collected in 2020, however, data collection is postponed due t to Covid-19- Report will be shared as a major result in the end of project)
Result on Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men civil servants (and # of with disabilities) feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4): Status: (CSPS) Survey data was planned to be collected in 2020, however, data collection is postponed due to Covid-19- Report will be shared as a major result in the end of project.
Result on Indicator 1.5 Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG Indicator 16.5.1): Status on track: As per 2019 findings of PPSOG, 15% stated that people have to pay bribe or give a gift to get a service from the government. 66% disagreed with this statement. No target is set for 2020 – Next survey will be done in 2022
Result on Indicator1.6: # of women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF 1.4.1): Status-Under collection: In 2018, the percentage of women holding position above Director level was a) 44.8% Data source: GEPA study Data for 2020 have been requested to DG of Central Statistical Organization and the annual report of PAPRD (Project appraisal and progress report department) of MoFP and CSO).
Result on Indicator 1.7: # of UCSB processes and procedures documented: Status: On track: On track: Business process mapping has been successfully carried out and report is shared with UCSB for review and feedback.
Result on Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures: Status: On track: Data requested to UCSB but not provided.
Result on Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity: Status:On track: On track
Code of Ethics has been successfully released and trainings are conducted by 2 CICS. Data are below.
Percentage of Women (including person with disability) who attended training at CICS. Upper Myanmar is 55.9% Lower Myanmar is: Men-44%, Women- 55%
Result on Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit: Status: On track: 36 Ministries has established corruption unit to deal with corruption cases. Integrity unit is yet to be established by UCSB. Cases will be handled by to be established HR departments. HR unit are in the process of approval by UGO.

Indicator 1.1:# of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel Target : 12
Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy Target: (a) 12 (b) 10
Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8) Targets: Gender discrimination 14%W 14%M; Racial Discrimination 13%W 13%M; Ethnic Discriminatiion TBDW% TBD%M
Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men (and # of with disabilities) civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4) Targets: Recruitment based on connections 19%W 19%M Promotions based on social connections 24%W 24%M Postings based on connections 20%W 20%M Promotions and postings based on bribes 17%W 17%M PWD:TBD
Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG indicator 16.5.1) Targets: N/A%W N/A%M
Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1) Targets : (a) 49%; (b) 2%
Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented Target : 0
Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures Target: 90%W 90%M
Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity Target : 100%W 100%M PWD
Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit Target : 0

Results on Indicators from M&E Framework (Jan-Dec 2021)
Result on Indicator 1.1: # of government agencies that disaggregate data on civil service personnel. Status: Same results with year 2020 and no progress because LEAP accordingly suspended his engagement with Myanmar’s institutions in compliance with the UNCT’s Engagement Principles following the Military Coup on 1 February 2021
Result on Indicator 1.2: # of government agencies that (a) have and (b) monitor gender, diversity and inclusivity targets aligned to 5 Year Civil Service Gender, Diversity and Inclusivity Strategy. Status: Same results with year 2020 and no progress because LEAP accordingly suspended his engagement with Myanmar’s institutions in compliance with the UNCT’s Engagement Principles following the Military Coup on 1 February 2021
Result on Indicator 1.3: % of women and men civil servants witnessing gender/race/ethnic discrimination at work (CPD Indicator 1.1.8). Status: Same results with year 2020 and no progress because LEAP accordingly suspended his engagement with Myanmar’s institutions in compliance with the UNCT’s Engagement Principles following the Military Coup on 1 February 2021
Result on Indicator 1.4: % of wo/men (and # of with disabilities) civil servants feeling recruitment, promotions and postings are based on connections or bribes (CPD Indicator 1.2.4). Status: Same results with year 2020 and no progress because LEAP accordingly suspended his engagement with Myanmar’s institutions in compliance with the UNCT’s Engagement Principles following the Military Coup on 1 February 2021
Result on Indicator 1.5: Proportion of persons who had at least one contact with a public official and who paid a bribe to a public official, or were asked for a bribe by those public officials, during the previous 12 months (MSDP Indicator 1.4.10 and SDG Indicator 16.5.1): Status: As per 2019 findings of PPSOG, 15% stated that people have to pay bribe or give a gift to get a service from the government. 66% disagreed with this statement. No target is set for 2021 – Although the Next survey was planned to do in 2022, it’s not possible anymore and the project is being shifted to the Community First programme.
Result on Indicator 1.6: Women holding senior position in the civil service (Director level or equivalent and above posts) as (a) percentage of total senior civil servants and, (b) increasing in percentage points from previous year (MSDP NIF Indicator 1.4.1). Status: Data for 2021 was not received because of the several situations after the event on 1 February 2021.
Result on Indicator 1.7: # of total UCSB processes and procedures documented. Status: Business Process Mapping Report of Human Resource Management System of the Union Civil Service Board developed and approved by UCSB.
Result on Indicator 1.8: % of wo/men UCSB staff briefed on UCSB processes and procedures. Status: no more engagement with UCSB after 1 February 2021 and no data.
Result on Indicator 1.9: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) civil servants trainees that are trained on the new Code of conduct and integrity. Status: No data received in 2021.
Result on Indicator 1.10: Proportion of cases dealt by UCSB Integrity Unit Status: No data received in 2021.
